channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for TN

item.title: Report X-2024050208
item.description:
Report X-2024050208

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-08T15:12:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-02
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The shipment was discovered leaking during sort operations. Inner contents: 1 metal can dented in multiple places on the can. The leak occurred from a dent on the bottom of the can. Remaining contents were placed in a salvage drum and held pending disposition from the shipper.

item.title: Report X-2024050108
item.description:
Report X-2024050108

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-08T15:12:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-30
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Hazmat spill. Leaking fiberboard box. Despite 96 applied by origin, package fails HAP due to 1) no overpack or UNPOP markings present; 2) Technical name used on shipping paperwork is trade name: (Limey Delimer). 0.4 gallon lost from four of four 1 gallon plastic bottles. Vented caps used but orientation arrows were not applied to two sides of package.

item.description:

  • City: MEMPHIS

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A fiberboard box with signs of a release was discovered during sort operations at the MEMH facility. The fiberboard box contained three alkaline batteries inside of a plastic bag with Styrofoam peanuts for dunnage. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2024050077
item.description:
Report X-2024050077

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-06T15:11:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-20
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: While offloading a bulk truck at the MEMH facility a fiberboard box with signs of a release was discovered. The fiberboard box contained four metal cans with fiberboard dividers. Two of the cans had open lids spiling the contents. the spill affected the surrounding packages. The leaking shipment was placed into a steel salvage package and an amended declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.description:
Report X-2024041604

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 4/30/2024 at approximately 0845, Dangerous Goods Adminstration received a call from Employee 926763 at the hub facility in Memphis, reporting a paint spill. The shipment is a plastic jerrican that appears to have been damaged by equipment. Approximately 1 liter of liquid spilled from the container. The shipment was placed in a salvage drum and awaits and amended shipper's declaration for further transport.

item.title: Report E-2024040650
item.description:
Report E-2024040650

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-02T15:12:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-29
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal NMP experienced a UN1760 Clothesline Fresh Bult Laundry Detergent 2 release from (2) 5-gallon poly pails. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2.5-gallons of product released from two pails due to damage caused by improper loading. The release impacted a 3’ x 12’ area of the trailer floor. The damaged pails were placed into a 55-gallon poly drum. Acid gator was then deployed to clean and neutralize the impacted trailer floor. All impacted absorbents and PPE were containerized into a second 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2024041562
item.description:
Report X-2024041562

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-02T15:12:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-25
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During sort operations at the MEMH facility a steel drum was dropped causing the bottom chime to open spilling all of it's contents. The spill was cleaned up and all materials and the drum were placed into a steel salvage package that will be sent out for disposal as hazardous material. UN spec of packaging was unable to be determined because the contents of the drum covered the exterior of the container.

item.title: Report E-2024040627
item.description:
Report E-2024040627

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-02T15:12:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-16
  • City: LEBANON
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DYNO NOBEL INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 237598
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: The CMTV was travelling east on Central Pike. It drove off the right side of the roadway, overcorrected, and then skidded across the center line and overturned onto its side. The CMTV skidded off the roadway through a fence and trees coming to a final rest in the field facing west. During the rollover the force of impact caused the manway failure. Approximately 2,000 lbs. of emulsion spilled from the tank onto the ground. A hazardous materials contractor recovered the spilled emulsion and remediated the soil.
